item.title: GOL SteamOS & Linux Survey results for March 2016
item.description:
GOL SteamOS & Linux Survey results for March 2016

Here are the latest results from the monthly GOL survey. These results are from the survey filled out this month in relation to March. Sadly a drop in responses this month, I am still bordering on doing this less frequently to prevent people burning out on it.

item.title: OBS Studio 0.14 Adds NVIDIA NVENC Video Encoding Support - Phoronix
item.description:
OBS Studio 0.14 Adds NVIDIA NVENC Video Encoding Support - Phoronix

The OBS Studio open-source software for screencasting and recording is now available as a major update. The multi-platform OBS Studio 0.14 release adds support for NVIDIA's NVENC encoder for video encoding on Windows and Linux using the NVIDIA API. There is also Intel QuickSync support for video encoding on Intel hardware, but that's Windows-only for now.

item.title: Wireshark 2.0.3 Free and Popular Network Scanner Released with Over 40 Bug Fixes
item.description:
Wireshark 2.0.3 Free and Popular Network Scanner Released with Over 40 Bug Fixes

Wireshark, the world's most popular, open-source, free, and cross-platform network protocol analyzer software used by security experts for troubleshooting, development, analysis, and education purposes, has been updated to version 2.0.3.

item.title: How to allow incremental file sync for many users on Linux - Xmodulo
item.description:
How to allow incremental file sync for many users on Linux - Xmodulo

Suppose you as a software developer has set up daily builds of your software for testing purposes. Every day you make a new build, users have to re-download the updated build to evaluate it. In this case you may want to enable differential downloads, so that users can download only difference between two builds, thereby ...Continue reading...

item.title: Cinnamon 3.0 Desktop Primed For Release - Phoronix
item.description:
Cinnamon 3.0 Desktop Primed For Release - Phoronix

The GNOME3-forked Cinnamon Desktop is ready for its 3.0 milestone. Linux Mint lead developer Clement Lefebvre has tagged version 3.0 of Cinnamon within their official Git repository on GitHub.

item.title: Microsoft reveals all about Windows 10's Linux subsystem
item.description:
Microsoft reveals all about Windows 10's Linux subsystem

The arrival of Bash in Windows 10 took many people by surprise, but it opens up a number of opportunities including the ability to run GUI Linux apps. But it's about much more than just that. Microsoft wants people who are confused about the arrival of (deep breath...)

item.title: Mozilla Firefox Will Support Ubuntu's New Snap Package Format - OMG! Ubuntu!
item.description:
Mozilla Firefox Will Support Ubuntu's New Snap Package Format - OMG! Ubuntu!

Today's release of Ubuntu 16.04 LTS brings Canonical's new Snap package system to millions of desktops. Canonical's new packaging format gets some big-name support As we highlighted earlier this week, Snaps can be installed side-by-side with the more familiar .Deb packages, giving users the best of both worlds.

item.title: Xubuntu 16.04 LTS and Lubuntu 16.04 LTS Released, Get Three Years of Support
item.description:
Xubuntu 16.04 LTS and Lubuntu 16.04 LTS Released, Get Three Years of Support

Xubuntu and Lubuntu are the last two official Ubuntu flavors released as part of the massive Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (Xenial Xerus) launch, and we're going to tell you a little about their presence.

item.title: Linux 4.6-rc5 Is Another Fairly Calm Weekly Kernel Update - Phoronix
item.description:
Linux 4.6-rc5 Is Another Fairly Calm Weekly Kernel Update - Phoronix

Linus Torvalds announced the release of the Linux 4.6-rc5 kernel a brief time ago. Torvalds explained of 4.6-rc5, "Things continue to be fairly calm: rc5 is bigger than rc4 was, but rc4 really was tiny.
